title: 115_hr1262
content: SECTION 1. TAX REPORTING FOR LIFE SETTLEMENT TRANSACTIONS. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to include a new section requiring returns for certain life insurance contract transactions. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code mandates reporting of details for life insurance contract transactions, including names, addresses, payment amounts, and policy information for both the buyer and seller. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code requires reporting of seller's basis in life insurance contracts, including seller's information, investment in the contract, and transfer details to a foreign person. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code requires reporting of seller's basis in life insurance contracts, including seller's information, investment in the contract, and transfer details to a foreign person. Every person required to make a return must furnish a written statement to each person whose name is required to be set forth in the return, showing the name, address, and phone number of the information contact, as well as the required information for each seller. Additionally, every person making a payment of reportable death benefits must make a return setting forth the name, address, and TIN of the person. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code requires reporting of seller's basis in life insurance contracts, including seller's information, investment in the contract, and transfer details to a foreign person. Every person making a payment must provide the name, address, TIN, and date of payment for each recipient. Additionally, a written statement must be furnished to each recipient with the name, address, and phone number of the information contact, along with the required payment information. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code requires reporting of seller's basis in life insurance contracts, including transfer details to a foreign person. The term 'reportable policy sale' is defined, and the term 'issuer' is clarified. 'Reportable death benefits' are also defined as amounts paid by reason of the death of the insured under a transferred life insurance contract. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new section, 6050X, which requires reporting of certain life insurance contract transactions. Conforming amendments are made to sections 6724 and 6047 of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new section, 6050X, requiring reporting of certain life insurance contract transactions. Subsection (g) is redesignated as subsection (h), with new provisions exempting information reported under section 6050X. Effective date for amendments is after December 31, 2017 for reportable policy sales and death benefits. SEC. 2. CLARIFICATION OF TAX BASIS OF LIFE INSURANCE CONTRACTS. Amends section 1016(a) of the Internal Revenue Code to clarify tax basis for certain charges under life insurance contracts. Effective date is after August 25, 2009. The amendment to section 101 of the Internal Revenue Code exempts commercial transfers of life insurance contracts from valuable consideration rules. A reportable policy sale involves acquiring an interest in a life insurance contract without a substantial relationship with the insured. The term 'indirectly' applies to the acquisition of an interest in a partnership, trust, or entity holding a life insurance contract, with exceptions for certain relationships and asset thresholds. Life insurance is not the main focus of the acquired entity. The gross value of assets includes the unborrowed policy cash values of life insurance policies and other assets' adjusted bases. A conforming amendment is made to section 101(a) of the law. The amendment to section 101(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes adding paragraph (3) in addition to paragraph (2). The effective date for these changes is after December 31, 2017.
